data.title: Amazing gumbo and beignets
data.text:
Love this place so much! It's a little spot and you might miss it if you aren't looking, but man oh man is it worth eating at! I have been to New Orleans many times and this is the only place in this area where you will find quality Cajun food. The food is delicious and the beignets are to die for. 

Ignore the person below's review - who honestly cares if they play Christian music? There is nothing offensive about it.

data.title: Great Food, Music Offensive
data.text:
I would have giving this place 5 stars except that if you are NOT christian, then you are forced to listen to very loud jesus music. I completely respect their right to believe in whatever they like, but do they really think that by forcing clients to listen to their religious music that we will actually be saved?  I digress. (sit outside if you can)

I followed the advice of many of the reviewers and started with the gumbo... it did not disappoint.  It tasted fresh and yummy and satisfying.  I could taste the care and love that went in to making it.

My daughter ordered the Tuesday special, All you can eat Shrimp and grits with the fried redfish.  The grits were amazing, but the shrimp was chopped up inside.  The fish was overdone and extremely salty.  She couldn't finish it.
I ordered the crawfish etufee eilee... it was amazing.  It was enough for two people. I may order this ToGo in the future so I don't have to sit and listen to the offensive music.
We had to beg for attention after the entree came as the staff was having a great time in the back talking.
We shared the bread pudding of the day which was pumpkin spice and it was so good, I only got three bites before my daughter finished it off.
All things considered,it was a great meal. Not sure we'll be back.

data.title: Authentic cajun food
data.text: Not a large space, but quaint.  If you are looking for real cajun cooking, then this is it.  Very good.  If you have time and a larger party go to their Dad's place in Fly, TN and tailgate while you wait for your table.  Both will not disappoint.

data.title: Great Cajun food
data.text: The name of the restaurant has changed to Boudreaux Brothers, but has the same great food and unique take on Cajun food. Small restaurant, so either go early or make reservations.

data.title: Good food!  Now known as Boudreaux Brothers
data.text: Have eaten here several times when i crave NOLA but can't get there!  I am sure you cant go wrong with anything on the menu but a good idea for lunch is to have an appetizer and the lunch portion of a dish... it is more than enough food!  Recently i had the fried crawfish tales appetizer with the crawfish etouffee and just let some of those fried crawfish swim in the sauce also!!!

data.title: A Gem!
data.text: By far the best Cajun food I have eaten, heck, best food in Franklin so far. Go for the BBQ shrimp, Shrimp Po Boy, Gumbo and Bread Pudding. Hands down best order for authentic taste and prices are outstanding. Their bottled beer selection unique and our seafood tasted fresh, fresh, fresh! Service was also polite and efficient. We cannot wait to come back!

data.title: Great food!!!
data.text: Located in beautiful downtown Franklin, Tennessee!  Papa Boudreaux's offers a wonderful experience, great food, and great service!  The Fried Shrimp Po Boy is amazing!

data.title: If you love Cajun food, this is your place.
data.text: I love this place. The food is out of this world and the atmosphere is down to earth wooden benches and tables and very relaxed. The restaurant is small but that is part of the draw. Prices are a little high but probably average for Franklin.

data.title: Nice Meal
data.text: A cosy and popular cafe which offered a gerat menu selection with good service. A good cajun flavour to the meals and the shrimp gumbo was very tasty

data.title: Cajun lovers
data.text: I have to say we tried a little of everything. My husband got the sampler (gumbo, etouffe, red fish, fried crayfish tails) and I got the jambalaya. Awesome food. Not one dish did we not like. The crayfish is the best I have ever had. All dishes phenomenal. Try the beignets and bananas foster bread pudding yummy!!

data.title: Wanted something different
data.text: Got the shrimp and grits first time I had cajun food. There was about 6 medium size shrimp and a bowl of cheese grits It didn't look like much but it was good. This is an expensive meal for 17 bucks 6 shrimp and grits but its like that everywhere I have eaten it since then.

data.title: Best Cajun in Middle Tennessee
data.text:
Incredible Crawfish Étouffée with added shrimp and fish. Very small place but great food and service makes this place a gem. 

IMHO the BEST Cajun food in Middle TN.

data.title: Excellent and Authentic Cajun Food
data.text: Our first time there after being told by friends that it was very good.  All authentic recipes with delicious flavors.  The Jambalaya is fabulous, as is the gumbo.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Quick mid afternoon visit for a little refuge from the afternoon heat!
data.text: While shopping in downtown Franklin, Tennessee last week we needed to get out of the heat mid afternoon! We stopped in for a quick sweet tea and ended up sharing some jambalaya! It was delicious, authentic and a wonderful to cool down!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I had the shrimp with Cheesey Grits  and it was outstanding. However I could not resist having beignets for dessert. They were the best I've ever had. It was like being in New Orleans.

data.title: Hillbilly 1/2 marathon visit
data.text: My husband had the gumbo and the portion was huge and came with French bread. He said it was pretty good. I had the garlic shrimp pasta and my portion was huge as well and very good. For an appetizer we had boudin balls and they were spicy and full of flavor! I love that they served Abita beer! We would definitely eat there again!

data.title: New Orleans in Franklin
data.text: Small restaurant, decorated in New Orleans color and beads.  Large selection of seafood choices. We split a chicken po boy sandwich and the daily special of peach bread pudding. The food was delicious. Would recommend this restaurant if you like this type of food.

data.title: Lunch in "Louisiana"!
data.text:
Culinary surprise in downtown Franklin, TN.

Chalie was our super-friendly server. She did a great job explaining the menu, and making excellent suggestions.

Fried Chicken Po' Boy, red beans and rice, peach bread pudding were our choices, paired with Albita Turbodog in a bottle, all the way from LA.

Glad we stopped in for a quick lunch!

data.title: Cajun food in Central Tennessee, YUM!
data.text: Jambalaya with red fish and Abita beer.  Yum!!!  Great food, nice staff.  Small place, but worth the stop.  The fish was perfectly cooked and delicious.  I 'saved' enough room for the beignets.  I even had lunch the next day from the leftovers.  Definitely worth the stop!

data.title: Little New Orleans in Franklin, TN
data.text: A great find in Franklin, TN. Owner's wife provided great service while her husband/chef cooked a fabulous Cajun meal. Would definitely go back.
